posts.post_content:
He's a titan, what more can be said?  
  
Seems to me, Wizards is stuck on a runaway cycle. They started printing better creatures, (more abilities, more aggressively/competitively priced) and aggro reigned. Then they printed more and better quality removal ([Path of Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path of Exile), for example) to try and balance it, and control took over. So to get past the removal, they made even BETTER creatures with more CIP effects or evasion to make them worth the cost even if they get shot down. Again, aggro stomped. And now we are here, with the titan cycle, six versions of [terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=terror) (each better than it in some way) and who knows what the next set will show.  
  
I know Control vs. Aggro should naturally ebb and flow but the steady one-upping they are doing lately doesn't seem like a good thing. I mean, where will it lead? Eventually we hit the "unstoppable force" of kill spells and the "immovable object" of evasive creatures. What then?
posts.html:
He's a titan, what more can be said?

Then they printed more and better quality removal (Path of Exile, for example) to try and balance it, and control took over. So to get past the removal, they made even BETTER creatures with more CIP effects or evasion to make them worth the cost even if they get shot down. Again, aggro stomped. And now we are here, with the titan cycle, six versions of terror (each better than it in some way) and who knows what the next set will show.

I know Control vs. Aggro should naturally ebb and flow but the steady one-upping they are doing lately doesn't seem like a good thing. I mean, where will it lead? Eventually we hit the "unstoppable force" of kill spells and the "immovable object" of evasive creatures. What then?

posts.post_content:
Mono-Green with this, [Dungrove Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dungrove Elder), and [Garruk, Primal Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Primal Hunter).
  
Sure, you're going to run a lot of ramp and other green-support.
  
But this guy's going to give Dungrove +2/+2 from each Forest you fetch, and Garruk's making two more 6/6's when his ultimate hits.
  
Not to mention keeping some [Fresh Meat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fresh Meat) around when a Day may hit.
  
Add some [Beast Within](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beast Within)s, and you're on your way to some good times.

Posted By: infernox10 (7/25/2011 10:59:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
combines the best aspect of green power and mana ramp.  
the tough part of a mana ramp deck is finding the early game balance between mana ramp cards so your later game strategy is playable, and playing creatures so you're still around for the later game.  
and if you think this guy is a later game card, well  
  
T1, forest, [llanowar elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=llanowar elves)/[Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf) (2 mana total)  
T2, forest, [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow), [rampant growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rampant growth) (5 mana)  
T3, forest, Primeval titan (8 mana)  
T4, whatever you want  
  
i've actually done that, and turn 4, i dropped a forest and [Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger)  
  
so, that's a 6/6 trampler and 8 mana at the end of turn 3. end of turn 4, i've got a 6/6 trampler and 7/6 trampler, and if i attacked with the titan, i've got 10 lands, which is 20 mana thanks to vorinclex. TURN 4  
  
5/5 by a landslide

@ MaelstromWrath  
  
Yes he would. The ability triggers when he attacks, so by time the damage is calculated, he'd get that +2/+2 bonus.  
  
That's a great strategy, however. Adding him into an Aura deck with [Bear Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bear Umbra) and something like [Omnath, Locus of Mana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Omnath, Locus of Mana) can REALLY make for some dangerous play.

Posted By: Ferlord (9/2/2011 7:08:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
You know, one of the funniest decks I've ever seen was a turn 4 Titan deck that centered around dropping something like [Inferno Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inferno Titan) or [Frost Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frost Titan), and to follow up next turn, dropping this guy and fetching a [Teetering Peaks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teetering Peaks) and [Soaring Seacliff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soaring Seacliff) to throw on your other Titan.  
  
He ran 2 [Teetering Peaks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teetering Peaks) and 2 [Soaring Seacliff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soaring Seacliff)s and would open up his Titans with them. It was so jank, but funny as hell to see play. He got 5th place at FNM with it as well.   
  
If you have these guys and wanna play a deck other than Valakut, give that shot. The look on your opponent's face is simply priceless the moment you drop those 2 lands.
posts.html:

He ran 2 Teetering Peaks and 2 Soaring Seacliffs and would open up his Titans with them. It was so jank, but funny as hell to see play. He got 5th place at FNM with it as well.

If you have these guys and wanna play a deck other than Valakut, give that shot. The look on your opponent's face is simply priceless the moment you drop those 2 lands.

Posted By: Revelation666 (7/7/2011 9:25:37 PM)

posts.post_content:
One of the best abilities cards in a deck that know how to take advantage of it :  
  
1. Deck thinned by 2 cards every turn.  
2. A 2-card advantage every turn.  
3. Deck shuffled afterwards : [Oracle of Mul Daya](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oracle of Mul Daya) and [Garruk's Horde](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Horde) and [Mul Daya Channelers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mul Daya Channelers) ability gets a chance to shine  
4. 2 extra lands on the next turn  
5. Massive landfall. With some protection (easy for green) he can take a while for your opponent to get rid of while you activate your landfall abilities at least twice a turn and before the declare blockers phase (important for some creature abilities).  
6. Doesn't limit you to basic lands.  
  
The 6 trample damage isn't even important on this card. That's how useful his ability becomes when you figure out how to combo it with the rest of your cards. Definitely a 5/5, but not 100% useful for every deck and every strategy.
posts.html:
One of the best abilities cards in a deck that know how to take advantage of it :

1. Deck thinned by 2 cards every turn.
2. A 2-card advantage every turn.
3. Deck shuffled afterwards : Oracle of Mul Daya and Garruk's Horde and Mul Daya Channelers ability gets a chance to shine
4. 2 extra lands on the next turn
5. Massive landfall. With some protection (easy for green) he can take a while for your opponent to get rid of while you activate your landfall abilities at least twice a turn and before the declare blockers phase (important for some creature abilities).
6. Doesn't limit you to basic lands.

The 6 trample damage isn't even important on this card. That's how useful his ability becomes when you figure out how to combo it with the rest of your cards. Definitely a 5/5, but not 100% useful for every deck and every strategy.
